title.narrative: Sustainable Living through social transformation and social justice in Myanmar (SLP)

description.narrative:
Gaia organization’s philosophy proposes to transform markets and education to be eco-friendly and socially just. Eco-friendly means that practices and products are in harmony with the environment. Socially-just means that there is fair trade (a fair price), local control over decisions, trust, harmony and collaboration. Markets and education are two key influences on sustainable living. In this sense, Gaia Organisation’s recently developed five-year draft strategy (2019-2023) has an overall objective which is to reach sustainable development and for communities to have social justice and social transformation in Myanmar.
For this project in particular CAFOD will support objective 3 of Gaia proposal which is: to mobilise movements and change agents to enable sustainable living in Myanmar. This is a continuation of their previous work under project code MYA198 through their Grassroots Leadership Trainings (GLT) for youth of different ethnic and faith groups in Myanmar. Gaia has a long history of mobilising change agents, especially through GLT and the networking of alumni and partners. Inner transformation is seen as a basis for social change as well as a opportunity to create a movement of like-minded people. This emphasis will continue in this program, but the content and form will adapt to the changes in context. For example, with modular and specialised content (such as with Peace Leadership, Strategic Leadership and Advanced GLT). This program will see new change agents recruited and equipped, as well as further development of existing alumni and partners, to take joint action. Follow up action will be enhanced. CAFOD will support Gaia's project for so they can revise GLT curriculum, provide advance courses, expand their alumni in Myanmar and consolidate a movement that can have a broader impact at the community and national level.
